paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: Age range: 40-70 years, both male and female, predominantly of Portuguese descent.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Sensory loss and motor weakness in lower limbs.
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient P1 presented with sensory loss and motor weakness in lower limbs at age 40.
Patient P2 reported autonomic dysfunction and neuropathic pain starting at age 48.
Patient P3, evaluated at age 55, reported no symptoms despite being a carrier.

functional_data.summary: Functional assays indicated that the V30M variant leads to unstable TTR tetramers.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families, particularly in Portuguese families.
variants.population_frequency: Prevalence of V30M is approximately 1 in 1000 in endemic areas.
variants.additional_notes: The V30M variant is the most common TTR mutation associated with ATTRv amyloidosis.
key_quotes: The most common TTR mutation in Europe is V30M, with prevalence reaching up to 1 in 1000 in endemic areas.
There is considerable variability in the penetrance, symptoms, and course of the disease across TTR variants.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for the TTR gene was extracted successfully.
